128T Release 3.2.0
128T Release 3.1.2
128T Release 3.1.0
128T Release 3.0.0
128T Release 1.1.0 (Initial revision)

This statement must be used as a substatement of any container in the stats datamodel that represents a metric. It indicates the type of the metric. Valid values are 'counter', 'meter', 'latency', and 'aggregate-meter'.
The memory policy needed to ensure consistent access to this value. Valid values are 'atomic' and 'transparent'.
Indicates that a metric represents a rate and its data will be retrieved with per-second units

Indicates that a metric should be synced to the given path in the state database.
Allowed values: platform, system, interface, processes (case sensitive)
Units represented by a scalar value.

The policy that dictates how long the value should be kept. Valid values: 'latest', 'short', 'long'. If no value is specified, the duration defaults to 'short'
latest: The value is saved for the duration of the sampling interval.
short: The value is saved for the configured short interval. Default duration is 1 hour.
long: The value is saved for the configured long interval. By default all samples are stored for one hour. One sample from that hour is stored one day. And one sample from the day is stored for six months.
The parent container for all metrics and metric groups
Stats pertaining to the DPI engine
Stats pertaining to the packets received by the DPI engine
Stats pertaining to successful processing of packets requiring DPI
Number of segments added to the packet cache
A string identifier which only uses alphanumerics, underscores, or dashes, and cannot exceed 63 characters.
